title: GM Workers in Mexico Elect New Union After USMCA Complaint
sub_head: Vote seen setting off a chain of challenges to incumbent unions
body:
MEXICO CITY—Workers at General Motors Co. ’s plant in central Mexico voted for a new labor union to represent them, replacing their previous union in a first test of labor provisions under the U.S.-Mexico-Canada trade pact aimed at improving worker conditions in the country.
The vote is likely to unleash a wave of challenges to incumbent unions across the country, moves that could eventually improve worker wages in Mexico but lead to higher costs for companies, analysts said.
